content:
Sure, here's a revised version:

Imagine being surrounded by crystal-clear waters and warm Hawaiian sunshine, standing on the deck of a boat as you witness a giant splash in the distance. As you turn to see an enormous humpback whale breaching just yards away, you and your family will experience a moment that you will never forget - all at the Hawaiian Islands Humpback Whale National Marine Sanctuary in Kihei. This incredible sanctuary is home to thousands of humpback whales each year, who come to breed, calve, and nurse their young. Encompassing approximately 1,165 square miles of ocean off the coast of Kihei on the island of Maui, the sanctuary was created to protect these majestic creatures.
